Package model

Class MinesweeperModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.MinesweeperModel
public class MinesweeperModel
extends java.util.Observable
A model to represent a minesweeper game. A model contains a MinesweeperBoard class containing the underlying tiles, and enforces game logic by setting bombs and "digging" tiles (by revealing the space and relevant neighbors).
Author:
Gary Li, Daniel S. Lee, Robert Schnell, Merle Crutchfield

  • Constructor Details

    • MinesweeperModel

      public MinesweeperModel()
      Constructs the Minesweeper model, initializes the bomb locations and checks how many mines are nearby. Hardcodes a 13 by 13 board of tiles.

    • MinesweeperModel

      public MinesweeperModel​(java.lang.String shape)
      Constructs the Minesweeper model given a custom shape. The shape must refer to the name of a text file (excluding ".txt") in the ./shapes/ folder. See MinesweeperBoard.loadShapeFromFile() for more details.
      Parameters:
      shape - A string referring to a file containing a custom shape for the board.

    • MinesweeperModel

      public MinesweeperModel​(MinesweeperBoard board)
      Constructs a model given a previously constructed minesweeper board.
      Parameters:
      board - A MinesweeperBoard instance

  • Method Details

    • setBombs

      public void setBombs​(int bombCount)
      Sets the bombs to random spots on the board. Uses logic to ensure that the correct number of bombs are placed and that they are all at different locations.
      Parameters:
      bombCount - The number of bombs to place

    • setSeed

      public void setSeed​(long seed)
      Sets the seed of the random number generator for bombs. Used for testing.
      Parameters:
      seed - A seed

    • getBoard

      public MinesweeperBoard getBoard()
      Returns the board Array
      Returns:
      Board Array

    • revealSpace

      public void revealSpace​(int x, int y)
      This method uses recursion to cave out the area of blank spaces done by a click. It checks to make sure that it is in range, and if not then it does nothing. It then checks if there is a bomb, which prompts the end of the game. Next, if it is a covered spot and there are 0 bombs nearby it clears itself and recursively calls again. The last condition is if it touches a bomb, which is will just reveal the spot.
      Parameters:
      x - A row coordinate.
      y - A column coordinate.

    • bombSquare

      public void bombSquare​(int x, int y, boolean ans)
      This method sets a square of bombs around a location to either be true or false. This is so that it ensures that the users first input is always not a number but instead clears out space.
      Parameters:
      x - A row coordinate.
      y - A column coordinate.
      ans - Boolean for setting bomb.

    • revealSpaceHelper

      public void revealSpaceHelper​(int x, int y)
      Private inner class that implements revealSpace without notifying observers (runtime optimization).
      Parameters:
      x - A row coordinate.
      y - A column coordinate.

    • notifyView

      public void notifyView()
      Notifies any observers that the model has changed.

    • flagSpace

      public void flagSpace​(int row, int col)
      This method flags the spot on the board when the user chooses to.
      Parameters:
      row - A row coordinate.
      col - A column coordinate.

    • revealMines

      public void revealMines()
      Reveals all mines in the board. This method can be called when the user clicks a mine.

    • getMineCount

      public int getMineCount()
      Returns the number of mines on the board.
      Returns:
      bombCount Total number of mines.

    • getFirstMove

      public boolean getFirstMove()
      Returns whether the next move will be the user's first move.
      Returns:
      True if the user has not placed a move, false otherwise

    • saveGame

      public void saveGame​(double time, java.lang.String name)
      Saves the game by serializing the board into a file named "save_game.dat"

    • getSave

      public boolean getSave()
      Returns whether the model has been loaded from a previously saved board.
      Returns:
      whether the model is loaded

    • getTime

      public double getTime()
      If the game has been previously saved, returns the time of the game when the board was saved.
      Returns:
      The previous time

    • getLost

      public boolean getLost()
      Returns whether the game has been lost.
      Returns:
      whether the game has been lost

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      If the game has been previously saved, returns the name of the player associated with the loaded board.
      Returns:
      The name of the player
